alert.note: Alert for Le Sueur; Scott; Sibley (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 9:39PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Henderson MN19 affecting Scott, Le Sueur and Sibley Counties. .Accumulating rainfall has occurred across southern Minnesota Friday night into this evening. Totals so far have reached 2 to even 4 plus inches in some localized areas with additional rainfall expected tonight. This has caused area rivers to rapidly rise. Crests should occur within the next few days before a dry pattern this coming week allows for rivers to decrease again. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Henderson MN19. * WHEN...From late Sunday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 736.8 feet, Highway 22 east of St Peter closed (estimated levels for spring flooding) * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 PM CDT Saturday, the stage was 729.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Monday morning and continue rising to a crest of 735.8 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 732.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 735.4 feet on 06/28/2018. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
